column40: Thank you for your compassionate contribution towards youth suicide prevention in Singapore!
column41: Thank you for your compassionate contribution towards youth suicide prevention in Singapore!
column46:
Suicide is the leading cause of death for those aged 10 to 29 in Singapore. In 2019, 71 persons aged 20 to 29 took their own lives.

Each youth suicide could have been prevented. Often, the person just wanted a way out of his or her pain and despair but had felt helpless and hopeless. As a community, we can do more to prevent the next youth suicide.

Ycare: Walking in their Shoes is a new community outreach programme that aims to empower young persons (age 18 to 25 years) with mental health challenges to recover and live well and prevent youth suicide. Scheduled to be launched in September, it aims to reach out to more than 1,000 young persons by end 2021.

Ycare: Walking in their Shoes has received a $20,000 grant from the Tote Board Mental Health Strategic Initiative. This grant will be used for the production of a new physical exhibit and event-related expenses.

To increase the impact of Ycare: Walking in their Shoes, Shan You will be partnering with the Singapore Repertory Theatre to use arts as a vehicle to create authentic conversations on mental health and suicide and bring communities together. It will be a sensory experience created using 5 verbatim stories incorporated into a 'pop up' immersive exhibition.

This fund-raising project aims to raise $15,000. All donations are eligible for tax-deductible relief of 2.5 times of the donated amount. All donations will be eligible for dollar-for-dollar matching contribution from the Tote Board and Singapore Government.
column47:
Shan You is a non-profit social service agency set up in 1995 to provide professional counselling and social care services based on the guiding values of compassion, mindfulness, morality, and wisdom. Our services are available to all in the community, regardless of race, religion and ability to pay. 
  
Shan You is a registered society and a charity with the status of Institutions of a Public Character (IPCs). Shan You is a full member of the National Council of Social Service (NCSS). 

With your monetary support, we will be able to continue to serve the community and our beneficiaries, building towards a caring and more resilient society!

column46:
When illness strikes, it is not just the patient, but the entire family is often affected - financially, emotionally; daily living routines are never the same again. 

It is also common for family members to quit their jobs to take on caregiving roles, particularly when the patients are not able to take care of their own personal needs alone. The loss of income cause great financial and emotional stress for both patients and their family members.  
 
This is where TTSH Community Fund comes in to support them so that they can better cope and manage. 
 
Some needy patients we help include those who are dependent on breathing equipment due to respiratory illnesses or conditions caused by other medical issues. 

Many such patients want to go home but they cannot afford the expensive out-of-pocket cost of the breathing equipment. TTSH Community Fund's Help Me Go Home Programme provides these patients with the much needed breathing machines and also cough assist machines where required, so that they can return home to their loved ones.
column47:
In keeping with Mr Tan Tock Seng's Legacy of Giving, Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH) set up its charity arm, TTSH Community Fund, in August 1995 to improve the quality of life of our patients and the community. 

Every year, our Charity disburses more than $2 million for our patient-centred programmes, and to support healthcare research, innovation and training for our staff and the community, to deliver better patient care. 

From expensive non-standard medication and breathing equipment to mobility aids, community rehabilitation programmes, and even dentures to help them eat better, TTSH Community Fund helps needy patients with their out-of-pocket medical expenses so that they can gain greater independence, improve their quality of life and enable them to integrate back into the community. 

Our Charity runs entirely on public donations. Every dollar to the Charity goes directly to support our activities. TTSH Community Fund is a registered charity with IPC status.

column47: The Singapore Red Cross (SRC) is a homegrown humanitarian organisation dedicated to relieve human suffering, protect lives and dignity and respond to emergencies since 1949. Our blood donor mobilisation programme, home for the disabled, transport aid, food aid, community led action for resilience, community first aid and training derive from our mission to serve the vulnerable.

column46:
A series of COVID-19 relief programmes has been launched in response to community needs with ardent supporters from all walks of life. What remains rooted is Tzu Chi's principle of "timeliness, directness, and respect" in handling crisis. For the past year, we have addressed needs of low income families and individuals, such as students who need learning devices, migrant workers, frontline personnel, small business owners, etc.

Amidst surging waves of pandemic globally, Singapore is transitioning into new norms with cases under control. We are grateful but mindful of the greater aftermath of the pandemic i.e. mental wellbeing issues and livelihood of the vulnerable community. With this in mind, Tzu Chi strives to continue supporting the needy through our  
- Local charity programmes: financial aid, healthcare and educational assistance schemes
- Medical services: GP, Dental and TCM 
- Education and humanistic culture programmes 
- COVID-19 relief initiatives

Every donation will be matched dollar-to-dollar by the government and philanthropic entrepreneurs. All contributions will then be channeled by Tzu Chi volunteers to our beneficiaries. This is how the power of one plus one can be greater than two.  

Having gone through a challenging 2020, we are thankful that we remain safe and healthy. Share your blessings with the people around you and keep the support strong by embracing the future with love and hope. Look forward to your continued support.
column47:
Established in 1993, Buddhist Compassion Relief Tzu Chi Foundation (Singapore) is an accredited Institution of Public Character (IPC). For the past over two decades, the Foundation has been actively contributing to society in the areas of charity, medical aid, education, humanistic culture, and environmental protection. 

We bridge and connect volunteers with those who need help; and in the process, we work out ways to help those who fall through society's safety net. Our work is manpower-intensive, but fortunately, we have an army of dedicated volunteers who generously devote their valuable time to help and care for the needy and underprivileged.
  
For inspiring news and stories about our charitable works and volunteers, please visit our website (www.tzuchi.org.sg), Facebook @tzuchisg or watch our videos on YouTube -tzuchisg.

Support Our Causes:
You can support our local charity programmes and other Missions of Tzu Chi Foundation (Singapore) by giving regularly to our Charity Development Fund. Your donatio

column46:
Mr Peh, 71, is the sole breadwinner and caregiver in his family, caring for his wife who has end-stage kidney failure and their 36 year old son with intellectual disability. HNF provides home nursing service to his family with full financial waiver, lifting the burden off Mr Peh's shoulder.

During our Grant A Wish campaign, Mr Peh's family's wish to install a water heater in their 2 room flat was fulfilled through your donations, bringing them joy and comfort.

Touched by your support, Mr Peh designed the cover to express his gratitude and impart blessings to you! Help us do more for families like Mr Peh with your donations and blessings!
column47:
Founded in 1976, Home Nursing Foundation is the oldest and most established charity organisation that provides home healthcare in Singapore. We deliver comprehensive care programmes that are dedicated to our patients, regardless of their income level. From nursing to medical care, to looking after patients' social well-being and other practical needs, we bring care and support into the homes of those in need.

We depend on the generosity of the public and organisations to provide funding to enable us to serve our patients. Our patients needs are our primary concern and your donation will go towards supporting the most needy of them. All donations to HNF qualify for 250% tax deduction.  All tax exemption receipts will be emailed, and hard copies are upon request only. For more information, please visit our website at www.hnf.org.sg

At SportCares, we use sport to change lives.

By nurturing confidence, building connections and cultivating care for all, including the vulnerable youth, families and seniors as well as the disabled and persons with special needs.

Your donation today will give a better tomorrow to the communities we serve.  On our part, we will continue to work hard to ensure that every bit that we receive will make a difference in their lives. 

All donations to SportCares above $10 will generate a tax credit of 2.5 times the original amount for the donor.

Equally important, if you know someone or a group that could do with a helping hand from SportCares, please reach out to us through sportcares@sport.gov.sg

column46:
Playeum strives for a world of inclusiveness, where every child of any socio-economic background and ability can play side-by-side without fear of judgement through the PIF fund.

Playeum works closely with community partners such as Family Service Centres (FSCs), Children's Home & Child Protection Services to ensure that children from marginalized backgrounds and as well as children with special needs have the space and time to play creatively. This is done through the support of the Play It Forward fund which supports all components of our hands-on STEAM programme for children and is free for our community partners.

Through open-ended play, children become masters of their own worlds where creating, exploring, conquering fears, negotiating, making decisions and resolving conflicts become second nature. Providing this physical space empowers children and allows them to step forward to become contributing global citizens.
column47:
Playeum is an independent charity organisation (IPC) that champions children through play, creativity and the arts. We advocate for children's voices and the development of crucial 21st century skills such as problem-solving, communication, collaboration, critical thinking and more, through the play and the arts. 

Through our deep-impact programmes and outreach that enhance social-emotional learning and confidence building, we work closely with children under our community partners such as Family Service Centres (FSCs), Children's Home & Child Protection Services, and as well as children with special needs to ensure that all children have the space and time to play creatively. 

Find out more about our work at https://www.playeum.com/.

column46:
Hello - thank you for vising our fund-raising campaign. We are EQUAL, a non-profit organisation that strengthens the emotional and mental well-being of people in need, using therapy horses and cats (dogs too, soon) that have themselves been rescued and given a second shot at life.

We are a team with a diverse crew of animal-assisted intervention professionals who are former MOE teachers, social workers, counsellors, animal trainers and jockeys. 

In EQUAL, we serve 1,500 beneficiaries every year, comprising youths, people with special needs, families, and the elderly with dementia and depression.

Through an Animal-assisted learning curriculum, EQUAL help people facing challenges open up to create changes in mindsets and behaviours that are deep and long-lasting; learning social-emotional skill sets that are important but conventionally hard to teach. This work is new to Singapore but Animal-assisted Learning and Therapy is well-established in Europe, North America, South America and Oceania with decades of proven outcomes.

To do our work, EQUAL relies heavily on support from the public, as government funding typically covers only a percentage of the costs of charities.

We hope you'll join us in our goal to raise $180,000 for all our beneficiaries and therapy animals, spreading the word about our Animal-assisted Learning programs that have empowered our beneficiaries to find a sense of purpose and identity. 

In doing so, we can continue to #HelpAnimalsHelp us
column47:
"The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated."
- Gandhi

Hello, we are EQUAL, a young Charity with IPC status. 

We believe animals make people better. 

Every year, we strengthen the mental health of 1,500 people with special needs, youth, families and elderly, through giving them the opportunity to care for and work with rescued therapy animals.

In other words, we rescue animals who go on to rescue us.

Our therapy horses and cats may not look the prettiest from the outside, but they are so beautiful inside.

Working alongside them as our partners, our team of certified professionals help our beneficiaries develop social-emotional skills such as managing impulsivity, compassion, responsibility, and confidence via an Animal-Assisted Learning curriculum.

These skills help our beneficiaries succeed in school, employment and life.

Such skills are vital, yet they are difficult to teach.

That's where EQUAL comes in. Animals help us connect with our inner w

Bring the festive cheer to the disadvantaged through your e-AngPow blessings. As we look forward to the New Year festivities, let's not forget the disadvantaged families and individuals who need extra love and a helping hand. Your giving brings hope to those who may be facing challenging circumstances.

Through your donation, we are able to continue the work of levelling the playing field for the disadvantaged- to bring joy to learning, to bring hope to the lost, to bring smiles to the lonely and to bring dignity those who have failed to get up and try again. 

We appreciate all donations, and even the tiniest bit helps us continue what we're doing. Thank you for your support towards our mission of touching hearts and building lives.
column47:
BCCS provides programmes and services to help the low-income/disadvantaged in the community. We hope to touch their hearts and lives through our personal care and attention. We walk with those in need to give them hope, to get them out of their seemingly helpless predicament, and spur them on in their journey to build their lives with dignity.

Our family-based services and programmes are founded on the belief that every individual deserves a chance to reach his/her potential. BCCS works on the premise that we who are blessed are to share the blessings with those less fortunate in our society through practical help for them. Through our literacy, mentoring, skills training and other family programmes, we reach out to children, youths, seniors and families who are disadvantaged by their circumstances.

column46:
Autism is a lifelong developmental disability that affects how people communicate and interact with the world around them.  The prevalence rate of autism in Singapore is about 1% of the population.

Given that autism is a lifelong disability, there is a need to develop services across the whole lifespan.  Besides early intervention and education, there is growing urgency and need to build more services for the adults.  Autism Resource Centre (Singapore) has started a training and job centre, Employability and Employment Centre and social enterprises, The Art Faculty and Professor Brawn, to create more job opportunities.  However, there are still gaps and unserved needs.

Your generous support will enable us to build more services to empower and transform lives so individuals on the autism spectrum too can lead independent and meaningful lives.  

Thank you so much for building and blessing our community!
column47:
ABOUT US
Autism Resource Centre (Singapore) or ARC is a not-for-profit charity based in Singapore.  Registered in 2000, it was started by professional and parent volunteers dedicated to serving children and adults on the autism spectrum to help these individuals lead meaningful and independent lives in society.

OUR PROGRAMMES 
To ensure individuals on the autism spectrum realise their maximum potential with the support of their caregivers and professional team, ARC provides a wide range of core services.

ARC started Pathlight School, the first autism-focused school in Singapore offering a unique blend of mainstream academics and life skills for primary and secondary students.

Other signature programmes include early intervention, training for professionals and caregivers, employability and employment services, enrichment programmes and library and information services.

ARC also operates two social enterprises, The Art Faculty and Professor Brawn, to create and provide more job opportunities for individual

This Lunar New Year, our volunteers from Needle Point specially designed and handcrafted these mandarin oranges bags for you to bring along during home visitations. 

Apart from the unique design, these bags are environmentally friendly and can also serve as a lunch bag.

Donate a minimum of $100 to receive a mandarin orange bag*. 
* Due to limited stock, we encourage you to show your interest in the redemption as soon as possible.  
* The material and prints for each piece may differ due to different fabrics. 
* There are 2 sizes of bags: Small would fit 2 oranges and Large would fit 4 oranges. Please note that bag size will be given at random.
* Self-collection at our office or opt for delivery. 

We hope to continue to bring festivity and warmth to the elderlies in the upcoming Year of Ox. Your generous support will enable us to continue to serve and care for our elderly.

All proceeds will contribute towards various aspects of care support such as daily meals, maintenance of equipment and infrastructure, transportation fees for seniors' medical appointments and many more.
column47:
Geylang East Home For The Aged was founded in December 1978 as a charitable welfare organization to provide quality care for the elderly.  
- Charity Registration Number 0342 
- ROS 165/2001 WEL 
- UEN No T01SS0110J 
- IPC NO. 000389. An approved institution of public character IPC authorized to receive tax-deductible donations. 
- It is a full member of National Council of Social Service  since 1-10-1990 
- The Management Committee consists of twelve Management Committee Members who are volunteers entrusted to administer the organization.

column47: Established in 1984 as a coeducational government school, Victoria Junior College has created many nostalgic memories for students and staff of the school, while striving for excellence. Today, the college enrols about 1,800 students, taught by about 170 dedicated teachers.The Victoria Junior College name is synonymous with a culture of excellence and innovation in both work and play. This is what sets us apart in the educational landscape of Singapore. While Victorians possess rigorous intellectual habits and academic excellence, they are also challenged to go beyond the everyday and pursue what their hearts desire. We value the diversity of Victorians and believe that there is nothing more important than helping them find their passion and purpose.  We hope for all Victorians to change the world in creative and meaningful ways. column46:
Clarity Singapore aims at increasing the awareness of the importance of mental health to the community and make further positive impact on the lives of persons with mental health conditions. 

Through your gift in this Lunar New Year, we will be able to achieve our goal. We are immensely grateful for your generous support.

Happy prosperous Lunar New Year 2021!
column47:
Clarity Singapore is a mental health charity that aims to assist persons struggling with or recovering from mental illness find hope and acceptance.  We provide community-based intervention through counselling and workshops to help persons with mental illness overcome their difficulties, regain independent living skills, self-confidence and integrate back into the community.  

As a Catholic Charity, we serve all, regardless of religion, race or nationality. Clarity is a member organisation of Caritas Singapore and National Council of Social Services.  Our services are located in  Yishun and Toa Payoh.
Early intervention is important for a successful recovery from mental illness.  It costs $40 to support 1 counselling session and $200 to organise a workshop.  Your generous donation will help us achieve our goals to help the marginalized.

column46:
Blossom Seeds supports needy seniors with medical conditions by accompanying them for their medical appointments and treatments.

Majority of these seniors are wheelchair- bound,  with chronic condition, from low-income families and with little/no family support.  On top of these life challenges , COVID-19 puts them in greater risk.  

Blossom Seeds aspires to make their journey possible and accompany them through their lives challenges.
column47:
Blossom Seeds Limited (BSL) is a registered charity with an Institution of a Public Character (IPC) status and a member of National Council of Social Service (NCSS). BSL is supported by BW Monastery primarily through its member's contribution as volunteers.

Our vision is to build a compassionate community where everyone blossoms. Our mission is to care for seniors with love and support them to actively care for others.

Blossom Seeds relies on the generosity of organizations and individuals to fund and sustain our free programs to continuously care for the needy elderly. We also welcome volunteers to join our friendly pool of Blossom Kakis to serve with love and care for the elderly at their homes. 

Our current address is at : 105 Canberra Street, #02-01, S750105. Tel: 62659 8614.

column3: Giving Tuesdays for Children with Disabilities
column37: Will fund towards Giving Tuesdays Programme, including admission, materials, manpower and logistics.
column38: Will fund towards Giving Tuesdays Programme, including admission, materials, manpower and logistics.
column39: Will fund towards Giving Tuesdays Programme, including admission, materials, manpower and logistics.
column40: Will fund towards Giving Tuesdays Programme, including admission, materials, manpower and logistics.
column41: Will go towards Giving Tuesdays Programme  and to Playeum Ltd.
column46:
Giving Tuesdays is a weekly play-based programme that takes place every Tuesday afternoon for children with varying disabilities. 

Little is known on how play supports children with a disability in terms of the development of executive and 21st century skills. Understanding what children can do through play is a process of discovery and Giving Tuesdays provides the opportunity for further exploration and observation on this. 

Over the last one year, we have had over 10 families who came regularly for the programme, where they engage in different forms of artful play - painting, role-playing, tinkering and more. Through different activities, they have been able to express their creative potential, develop crucial skills such as communication and collaboration, and form new meaningful relationships. We are also witnessing how parents of these families are gradually forming a community, as they interact and share relatable experiences. 

With the first programme piloting at the Children's Centre for Creativity, it is now making its way directly into schools (and other spaces) to support children with disabilities. 

We are seeking for more donations to support more children to be part of Giving Tuesdays.
column47:
Playeum is an independent charity organisation (IPC) that champions children through play, creativity and the arts. We advocate for children's voices and the development of crucial 21st century skills such as problem-solving, communication, collaboration, critical thinking and more, through the play and the arts. 

Through our deep-impact programmes and outreach that enhance social-emotional learning and confidence building, we work closely with children under our community partners such as Family Service Centres (FSCs), Children's Home & Child Protection Services, and as well as children with special needs to ensure that all children have the space and time to play creatively. 

Find out more about our work at https://www.playeum.com/.

column46: This is the BB Week Campaign for 34th Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by Marsiling Secondary School and Adam Road Presbyterian Church. Thank you for donating!
column47:
The Boys' Brigade (BB) was founded in Glasgow, Scotland, in 1883 as a uniformed youth organisation. Today, the movement has spread across the globe with over half a million members worldwide. 
 
The BB in Singapore was founded on 12 January 1930.  We employ a holistic approach in the development of youths. Through our programme, we hope for our youths to be world-ready, with the passion to act on their dreams and to serve and care for the community.

Boys and Youths discover more about themselves, overcome challenges and broaden their perspectives through our exciting outdoor adventure activities, meaningful community projects and enrichment programmes. Increasingly, the emphasis is on leadership development, team building, life skills, adventure activities and community service.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 41J Singapore Company. 

Our Company is sponsored by Tao Nan School and Faith Community Baptist Church. 

Thank you for donating!

41J, Tao Nan School(TNS) was established in 1986 and is an integral part of student life in TNS. In The Boys' Brigade, the Boys learn different skills and character values that allow them to grow as young boys.

For this year's BB Week, a simple act of generosity from you can help our Boys look forward to exciting programmes that can continue to help them discover more about their talents and skills!

Though the Boys went through online CCA in the pandemic year, this did not stop them from looking forward to the activities planned out for them in 2021. With each of your generosity, the Boys will be well supported in the different programmes to uncover their potential.

We also believe that the Boys will learn to be responsible citizens by serving their community. They will be given opportunities to serve the community, such as BB Share-a-gift (where they get the chance to bring their parents along and deliver bags of items to the families) and BB Cares (where they get to serve at the elderly homes).

41J, Tao Nan School, believes that your support would spur our Boys to continue to look forward to the fun and meaningful activities in The Boys' Brigade every week.

Boys and Youths discover more about themselves, overcome challenges and broaden their perspectives through our exciting outdoor adventure activities, meaningful community projects and enrichment programmes. Increasingly, the emphasis is on leadership development, team building, life skills, adventure activities and community service.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 48th Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by Zhonghua Secondary School and Bethel Presbyterian Church. Thank you for donating!

The 48th Company started at Zhonghua Secondary School in March 2000 by LTA Fong Kum Fai with the assistance of NCOs (Lim Fei Min, Andy Goh, Maurice Leo and Lin Datong) from the 24th Singapore Company. With Bethel Presbyterian Church as the sponsoring church, the Company started with just 15 Boys and Mr. David Wong as the teacher-in-charge.

Despite our relatively short history, we grew stronger and began to find our forte through an eclectic mix of adventure, discipline and character-building. With that, the Company has been awarded the J M Fraser Bronze Award in 2003. Since 2008, we are proud to say that we have been obtaining the J M Fraser Gold Award.

Today, the Company has over 50 Boys, 5 Officers, 3 Primers and 2 volunteers. The teachers-in-charge from Zhonghua Secondary are also invaluable partners who play significant roles in contributing to the growth of the Boys. The Company strives to do its utmost through the delivery and imparting of life-changing and interesting character-molding lessons and mentoring to the Boys. We will also continue to give back to the community through our BB CARES outreach to the elderlies in the nursing home and the BB Share-a-Gift project with the collection of food rations and distribution to the needy. Here is the link for the 20th anniversary magazine: shorturl.at/ckuD3

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 81J Singapore Company. 

Our Company is sponsored by Townsville Primary School and Faith Community Baptist Church. 

Thank you for donating!

81J, Townsville Primary School(TVPS) was established in 2001 and is an integral part of student life in TVPS. In The Boys' Brigade, the Boys learn different skills and character values that allow them to grow as young boys.

For this year's BB Week, a simple act of generosity from you can help our Boys look forward to exciting programmes that can continue to help them discover more about their talents and skills!

Though the Boys went through online CCA in the pandemic year, this did not stop them from looking forward to the activities planned out for them in 2021. With each of your generosity, the Boys will be well supported in the different programmes to uncover their potential.

We also believe that the Boys will learn to be responsible citizens by serving their community. They will be given opportunities to serve the community, such as BB Share-a-gift (where they get the chance to bring their parents along and deliver bags of items to the families) and BB Cares (where they get to serve at the elderly homes).

81J, TVPS, believes that your support would spur our Boys to continue to look forward to the fun and meaningful activities in The Boys' Brigade every week.

This is the BB Week Campaign for 82nd Singapore Company. 

Our Company is sponsored by Boon Lay Secondary School and City Harvest Church. 

Do you believe in our youths to become leaders of tomorrow? At 82nd Company, we are focused on mentoring and developing our Boys to be men of significance. We aim to equip them with relevant leadership skills along with empathy to care for their families and communities. We remain committed to their holistic development through local and overseas projects, and these require financial resources. Your giving empowers us to provide opportunities and enable them to step up to maximise their potential. Every donation matters!

Thank you for donating!

The Boys' Brigade (BB) was founded in Glasgow, Scotland, in 1883 as a uniformed youth organisation. Today, the movement has spread across the globe with over half a million members worldwide. 
 
The BB in Singapore was founded on 12 January 1930.  We employ a holistic approach in the development of youths. Through our programme, we hope for our youths to be world-ready, with the passion to act on their dreams and to serve and care for the community.

Boys and Youths discover more about themselves, overcome challenges and broaden their perspectives through our exciting outdoor adventure activities, meaningful community projects and enrichment programmes. Increasingly, the emphasis is on leadership development, team building, life skills, adventure activities and community service.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 7J Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by St. Andrew's Junior School and Church of The Ascension. Thank you for donating!

The 7J Singapore Company in St Andrew's Junior School was officially founded on 14 Sep 2009, sharing common history with 7th Singapore Company since its founding in 1938.

On 8 March 2020, The 7J Singapore Company was assessed to meet the criteria and was recognised for its excellence with our own Company Colours.

Besides regular parades of Badgework, Drill, and Inter-Squad Games, additional activities include Parent-Child Beach Clean-up, Day Camps, Indoor Softarchery.

Together with Church of the Ascension as the Sponsoring Church, the Company seek to awaken the hearts of Boys towards God, growing in wisdom and stature, in favour with God and man.

Ever onward to the fight.
Ever upward to the Light.
Ever true to GOD and RIGHT.
Up and On!

The Boys' Brigade (BB) was founded in Glasgow, Scotland, in 1883 as a uniformed youth organisation. Today, the movement has spread across the globe with over half a million members worldwide. 
 
The BB in Singapore was founded on 12 January 1930.  We employ a holistic approach in the development of youths. Through our programme, we hope for our youths to be world-ready, with the passion to act on their dreams and to serve and care for the community.

Boys and Youths discover more about themselves, overcome challenges and broaden their perspectives through our exciting outdoor adventure activities, meaningful community projects and enrichment programmes. Increasingly, the emphasis is on leadership development, team building, life skills, adventure activities and community service.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 14th Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by Anglican High School and All Saints' Church (English Congregation). Thank you for donating!

"In The Boys' Brigade 14th Singapore Company, based in Anglican High School, we aim to develop all Boys who pass through our ranks into fine young Men who are leaders of sound character and godly values. We do this by exposing our Boys to a wide array of adventure activities such as hiking expeditions, archery and high elements aimed at developing character, leadership and team-building skills. As the Boys promote through our ranks, they are accorded appointments which give them the invaluable opportunity to plan and execute various programmes as well as to lead their peers and younger Boys. The annual BB CARES project is one example in which our Boys are given the opportunity to lead in planning and execution. Beyond leadership abilities, community service projects like BB CARES and BB Share-a-Gift also allow our Boys to give back to the community.

BB Week is our annual fundraising event. Since the founding of the 14th Singapore Company in 1986, we have been organising many fun and wholesome activities to hone our Boys' character and leadership abilities. Your generous donations will go a long way in helping us to continue enriching young lives and to groom the leaders of tomorrow!"

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 31st Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by Bowen Secondary School and Ang Mo Kio Methodist Church (TRAC). Thank you for donating!

Here in the Boys' Brigade 31st Singapore Company, our hallmark is in developing the character of our Boys through a plethora of activities throughout their 4-year journey with us. These include conducting community service projects to help those around us who are in need. One example is our annual visits to Teck-Ghee Vista Seniors Activity Centre. Your donations will go a long way in nurturing our Boys to become true men with Christian values.

This is the BB Week Campaign for 33J Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by Fairfield Methodist School (Primary) and Aldersgate Methodist Church. Thank you for donating!

The 33J Boys' Brigade Company prides itself on helping our Boys with character and leadership development, family engagement, and community service. With a rich and holistic curriculum involving cognitive, emotional, personal, physical, and social elements that facilitates our Boys to serve and lead, our programme builds up our Boys to have the skills they need to succeed in school, at home, and to the community at large, being a blessing to those around them. Your generous contributions will help our Company by going towards modules that equip our Boys with navigational skills, future-ready competencies in coding, and project planning and fundraising experience, amongst other skills. Through these, our Boys are instilled with the positive learning dispositions to become lifelong leaders with a heart to serve. We appeal for your support to donate whatever amount may be comfortable for you - all of which will go a long way to serve the Boys we mentor.
column47:
The Boys' Brigade (BB) was founded in Glasgow, Scotland, in 1883 as a uniformed youth organisation. Today, the movement has spread across the globe with over half a million members worldwide. 
 
The BB in Singapore was founded on 12 January 1930.  We employ a holistic approach in the development of youths. Through our programme, we hope for our youths to be world-ready, with the passion to act on their dreams and to serve and care for the community.

Boys and Youths discover more about themselves, overcome challenges and broaden their perspectives through our exciting outdoor adventure activities, meaningful community projects and enrichment programmes. Increasingly, the emphasis is on leadership development, team building, life skills, adventure activities and community service.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 62nd Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by Orchid Park Secondary School and Yishun Methodist Mission. Thank you for donating!

62nd Singapore Company started in Orchid Park Secondary School in the Year 2000. During the past 21 years, we reached out to countless Boys whose lives are positively impacted by the work done in The Boys' Brigade.

Through your donation, 62nd Singapore Company will be able to channel those funds to good use. Your donations will help fund fun programmes and activities for the Boys, making sure that their journey in The Boys' Brigade is memorable. We seek to provide robust programmes that focus on Character and Leadership Development. 

In The Boys' Brigade, we seek to provide fun, meaningful & challenging activities. We commit to nurturing the Boys in community partnership and serving the community whenever possible.

Your donation will be purposeful and fruitful in ensuring that the Boys from 62nd Singapore Company benefit from engaging programmes throughout their journey.

Your donation will be significant in making a difference in the lives of the Boys. Donate to us today.

Thank you.

column46:
This is the BB Week Campaign for 64th Singapore Company. Our Company is sponsored by Ang Mo Kio Secondary School and St John's Chapel. Thank you for donating!

We aim to develop our Boys to be mentally, socially and physically strong youths.

Our vision is aligned with the BB Object, which is the advancement of Christ's kingdom among Boys and the promotion of habits of Obedience, Reverence, Discipline, Self-respect and all that tends towards a true Christian manliness. Our theme for 2021 is to Walk in Love amongst the Boys & Officers, adapted from 1 Corinthians 13:4-8. 

As serving the community is one of BB's key beliefs, we aim to develop Boys who have the heart and willingness to serve others through projects such as BB Share-A-Gift, BB Cares, outreach to kindergartens and letting them be involved directly in the planning and execution of meaningful activities to demonstrate their compassion and commitment.


During weekly parades, apart from letting the Boys learn about desirable moral values through the sharing of Biblical verses and stories, they are also exposed to drill and adventurous activities that aim to strengthen their personal mastery in these areas. They can also participate in Brigade level competitions such as the annual BB Blaze and BB Character Quest. 

With the addition of a new bagpipe band, our Boys can choose to be part of the band and be trained by experienced instructors and thereafter be given performance opportunities.

column3: Donate to Make Caring for Dementia More Affordable #SGCares
column37: No donation is too small and your contribution will make a real difference to the lives of people living with dementia and their caregivers. Thank you on behalf of our beneficiaries.
column38: No donation is too small and your contribution will make a real difference to the lives of people living with dementia and their caregivers. Thank you on behalf of our beneficiaries.
column39: No donation is too small and your contribution will make a real difference to the lives of people living with dementia and their caregivers. Thank you on behalf of our beneficiaries.
column40: No donation is too small and your contribution will make a real difference to the lives of people living with dementia and their caregivers. Thank you on behalf of our beneficiaries.
column41: No donation is too small and your contribution will make a real difference to the lives of people living with dementia and their caregivers. Thank you on behalf of our beneficiaries.
column46:
At the Alzheimer's Disease Association, we run multiple centres and programmes including the New Horizon Centres, Family of Wisdom Centres, Support for Caregivers, Volunteer programmes and other public education work. 

Our work plays an essential role in delivering social services to those who need support and from FY2019-2020, our programmes and services take care of 6,400 persons living with dementia, family/ domestic/ professional caregivers. 

With Singapore's ageing population and rising costs of living, ADA's services are more important than ever. To continue providing a good quality of care, we require the support of the public to keep caring for dementia more affordable. All proceeds will go towards helping Singapore strive towards a more dementia inclusive society, and will help greatly in ADA's continued provision and improvement of various programmes, services and operations.

Please support us during this challenging period. Thank you.
column47:
Alzheimer's Disease Association (ADA) was formed in 1990 as a result of a growing concern for the needs of persons with dementia, their families and caregivers. 

Through our work, the Association hopes to reduce stigma by increasing awareness and understanding of dementia, enabling and involving persons living with dementia to be integrated and accepted in the community, and leading in the quality of dementia care services which support persons with dementia and their families. 

As a non-profit organisation, ADA operates with limited resources. We cannot battle dementia alone. Donation will help fund our programmes and services that will benefit our beneficiaries and their families.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

column46:
The Boys' Brigade in Singapore is relocating to new Headquarter premises at 10 Kwong Avenue soon, where we will continue our mission in mentoring and training Boys and youths into responsible citizens and leaders in society. The premises will be developed in phases across 2021 and 2022.

Every dollar you donate to this campaign not only helps to build up our new Headquarters, but it is foundational in fulfilling our fresh visions of nurturing young lives and promoting intergenerational community life in the surrounding precinct!  We hope to start new BB Companies at the premises and also provide new engagement activities to serve the community as well as BB members and stakeholders.

So, join us today in creating a supportive and fun learning hub with exciting adventure, leadership and values-in-action programmes for BB Boys, our stakeholders and the community!

We hope for your generous support in carrying out our mission, as we have done for the past 91 years in Singapore!  We strive to continue the good works with our stakeholders and journey together towards our centennial year in 2030!
column47:
The Boys' Brigade (BB) was founded in Glasgow, Scotland, in 1883 as a uniformed youth organisation. Today, the movement has spread across the globe with over half a million members worldwide. 
 
The BB in Singapore was founded on 12 January 1930.  We employ a holistic approach in the development of youths. Through our programme, we hope for our youths to be world-ready, with the passion to act on their dreams and to serve and care for the community.

Boys and Youths discover more about themselves, overcome challenges and broaden their perspectives through our exciting outdoor adventure activities, meaningful community projects and enrichment programmes. Increasingly, the emphasis is on leadership development, team building, life skills, adventure activities and community service.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

Clarity Singapore aims at increasing the awareness of the importance of mental health to the community and make further positive impact on the lives of persons with mental health conditions. 

Through your gift during season of Lent, we will be able to achieve our goal. We are immensely grateful for your generous support.
column47:
Clarity Singapore is a mental health charity that aims to assist persons struggling with or recovering from mental illness find hope and acceptance.  We provide community-based intervention through counselling and workshops to help persons with mental illness overcome their difficulties, regain independent living skills, self-confidence and integrate back into the community.  

As a Catholic Charity, we serve all, regardless of religion, race or nationality. Clarity is a member organisation of Caritas Singapore and National Council of Social Services.  Our services are located in  Yishun and Toa Payoh.
Early intervention is important for a successful recovery from mental illness.  It costs $40 to support 1 counselling session and $200 to organise a workshop.  Your generous donation will help us achieve our goals to help the marginalized.

column46:
At Esplanade, we believe that the arts transforms lives and uplifts spirits. This is why more than 70% of our 3,500 performances and activities are presented free for all to enjoy each year. Through videos, podcasts, stories and more on Esplanade Offstage (www.esplanade.com/offstage), our online all-access backstage pass and insider's guide to Singapore and Asian arts and culture, we also give everyone continued access to the arts even from home.

As a charity with a social mission, communities in need, including seniors, children, youth and people with special needs, are also a key area of focus for Esplanade's community engagement efforts. We've witnessed how the arts can help build confidence, heal broken spirits and bring people closer.

Every year, we work closely with artists and social service organisations (SSOs) to bring transformative and meaningful arts experiences to over 17,000 beneficiaries from communities in need. These include long-term flagship projects that give beneficiaries hands-on opportunities to engage with the performing arts and reap its benefits, as well as workshops and visits for beneficiaries to enjoy performances at Esplanade. 

Your donation helps us to bring the joy of the arts to our diverse communities.
column47:
Esplanade is Singapore's national performing arts centre and a not-for-profit organisation with a social mission.

We believe that the arts can transform lives through its ability to uplift spirits, provide inspiration, foster bonds and cultivate understanding. The arts can bring individuals and communities closer together and it is our vision to be a performing arts centre for everyone.

Esplanade operated by The Esplanade Co Ltd (TECL), which is a not-for-profit organisation, a registered Charity and an Institution of a Public Character. The Charity Council awarded TECL the Charity Governance Award (Special Commendation for Clarity of Strategy) in 2016, and the Charity Transparency Award for four consecutive years since 2016.

column46:
By 2040, neurodegenerative diseases like dementia and Parkinson's disease will overtake cancer to become the second leading cause of death globally.*

These conditions that affect the brain and nerves worsen over time. There are currently no cures. 

Today,
1 in 10 aged 60 and above in Singapore has dementia.
1 in 4 will suffer a stroke in their lifetime. 
Up to 8000 Singaporeans have Parkinson's disease in Singapore.

Our goal is to stop these conditions from devastating more lives.

Driven by the National Neuroscience Institute (NNI), the Neuroscience Academic Clinical Programme (NEUROSC ACP) combines the strengths of SingHealth Group and Duke-NUS Medical School. The programme drives research and education innovation to improve care for today's patients and future generations. 

Our researchers are committed to finding better ways to prevent, diagnose and treat diseases like dementia, stroke, Parkinson's disease and brain tumours. 

You can help us make ground-breaking discoveries that transform patients' lives.

Your gift can help:
- Improve understanding of how these diseases develop and progress
- Develop better ways to prevent, diagnose and treat patients' conditions 
- Change the future of neuroscience by educating the next generation of leaders 

Make a difference now!

Find out more at www.nni.com.sg 

*Neurological and Sense Disorders Taskforce, 2017, National Medical Research Council Singapore
column47:
Transform Lives. Improve Care.

National Neuroscience Institute (NNI) cares for close to 80% of the nation's patients for conditions affecting the brain, spine, nerves and muscles. These conditions change people's lives forever. Some patients lose control of their body functions. Others suffer memory loss. Eventually, many lose both.

The World Health Organisation predicts that by 2040, neurodegenerative diseases such as dementia and Parkinson's disease will overtake cancer to become the second leading cause of death after cardiovascular disease.* We need your help to stop these diseases from shattering more lives.

Together, we can do more by enhancing care treatments and supporting patients in financial need, accelerating medical research discoveries, advancing medical training for healthcare professionals and other unmet needs - to offer our patients hope in their fight to live.

*Neurological and Sense Disorders Taskforce. (2017). Neurological Sense Disorders Taskforce Report (p.2). National Medical Resea

column46:
What defines a strong family? 
How does resilient living look like? 
Where does a beautiful mind reside?

As Epworth starts our e-flagday this year, we are not doing things the same. We want to invite you to give, and to come alongside us on a journey as we open our eyes to see, our ears to listen, our hearts to feel and reflect on some of the real-life challenges of people around us. 

Without a doubt, 2021 is a year of marked change. Since a year ago when COVID hit our shores, we have been swept by waves of change, fear, apprehension and loss. For some of us, it is easier but for others the effect is still severe.

Now more than ever, Epworth needs to continue our work to help at-risk children and youths from needy and disadvantaged families.  The funds will go towards promoting the mental well-being of children and youths by building strong families and imparting skills for resilient living. We want to create a better world for them so that they can develop their potential.

- The boy in class struggling to finish writing a sentence, is he just lazy? 
- The parent next door who is always shouting, are the kids just disobedient? 

Follow us on our FB: epworthcommunityservices/ INSTA: epworth.sg to find out more about who exactly are these people and what are their needs. 

Would you consider giving generously, and engage meaningfully with us?
column47: Epworth Community Services is a non-profit organisation that helps at-risk children and youths from needy and disadvantaged families. We want to create a better world for them so that they can develop their potential. Our work focuses on promoting the mental well-being of children and youths by building strong families and imparting skills for resilient living.The Society is a registered charity, a full member of the National Council of Social Service (NCSS) and an Institution of a Public Character (IPC).*All local donations qualify for 2.5 times tax exemption.**Epworth Community Services was formerly known as MCYC Community Services Society.

column46:
June 27 was the birthday of Helen Keller (a remarkable American educator, disability activist and author) one of the most well-known deafblind people in history, for this reason June 27 is celebrated as the International Day of Deafblindness and it encourage increasing public awareness for people with deafblindness in our communities.

Do You Know - 

Deafblindness is a combination of sight and hearing loss that affects a person's ability to communicate, access information and get around. A deafblind person won't usually be totally deaf and totally blind, but both senses will be reduced enough to cause significant difficulties in everyday life.

At SADeaf, our mission is assist the Deaf to achieve a better quality of life and to enable them to integrate and contribute to society and it includes the Deaf, hard of hearing and Deafblind. 

Currently, SADeaf provides a tailored programme for the Deafblind to help them integrate into daily life and contribute to the society. These services include: 

- Case Management/Counselling
- Communication Skills
- Activities of Daily Living Skills
- Independent Traveling Skills
- Education & Employment 

At such, we are appealing for your generous support to allow us to execute these plans knowing that resource will be made available and that prompt follow up can be done with sufficient funds throughout the year in case of sudden emergency. 

We thank you.
column47:
The Singapore Association for the Deaf (SADeaf) is a social service organisation that has been serving the Deaf and Hard-of-hearing community in Singapore for the past six decades. 

Established in 1955, SADeaf serves over 6,000 (FY19/20) Deaf and Hard-of-hearing persons. A member of the National Council of Social Service (NCSS) and, is also supported by the Community Chest of Singapore, Ministry of Education (MOE) and the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF). Internationally, SADeaf is affiliated to the World Federation of the Deaf (WFD) and locally to the Children Charities Association (CCA).

SADeaf mission is to assist the Deaf and hard-of-hearing persons to achieve a better quality of life and to enable them to integrate and contribute to society.

It costs SADeaf approx. $5.1 million per year to run all its services and programmes and is dependent on the bulk of its funding on the generosity of corporate and the general public.

column46:
About International Week for the Deaf

International Week of the Deaf (IWD) is an initiative of the World  Federation of the Deaf (WFD) and was first launched in 1958 in Rome, Italy. It is celebrated annually by the global Deaf Community on the last week of September each year to commemorate the same month the first World Congress of the WFD was held. IWD is celebrated through various activities by the respective Deaf Communities worldwide.

IWD sees highly concerted global advocacy to raise awareness about the Deaf Community on different levels. It is about gathering together, becoming united, and showing that unity to the rest of the world. IWD strives to promote the human rights of deaf people and highlight topics that merit attention. IWD aims to call for unity from the rest of the world through consistent, coordinated and widespread mobilization to ensure that the campaigns are visible through sufficient media coverage.

SADeaf mission to assist the Deaf to achieve a better quality of life and to enable them to integrate and contribute to society align with WFD goal and we are proud to celebrate IWD annually with a series of events and activities. 

Thru raising awareness, we hope to secure funding and support from the public to ensure that everyone receive the support they require and live their life to the fullest. 

SADeaf IWD 2020 videos: https://www.facebook.com/watch/593457710698251/990727634775632

Please support us with a donation today and be a life changer.

column46:
Established in 1955, the Singapore Association for the Deaf (SADeaf) has been serving the Deaf and Hard-of-hearing community for the past six decades.

Celebrating its 66th Anniversary in 2021, we continued to lead in advocating equal opportunity, in all aspects, for the Deaf and supporting the Deaf to reach their full potential and to assist the Deaf to achieve a better quality of life and to enable them to integrate and contribute to society.

While the journey has been challenging and fruitful, we remain highly affected by the volatile economic environment. Public donation and funding remain a major aspect in keeping the association afloat and to carry on its critical operations for those in needs. 

S$5million is required annually to ensure our ongoing services are not disrupted, we seek your generous support as we celebrate our 66th year in this great cause and to continue partnering us in this long journey. 

All donations received will goes a long way in ensuring key services remain accessible to our existing clients and to support more in needs in time to come. 

Please visit our website at www.sadeaf.org.sg to find how we can support and partner those in need (Deaf, Hard-of-Hearing and Deafblind).

We thank you for your support. 

Make a donation, Be a life Changer.

column46:
DO YOU KNOW? 

In Singapore, every baby receives a hearing test at birth, which is known as universal newborn hearing screening. Research has showed that about 0.1% (or 1 of every 1,000) babies born in Singapore have severe or profound hearing loss, and about 0.5% (or 5 of every 1,000) have lesser degrees of hearing loss. 

In addition, Singapore is the second fastest ageing nation in Asia after Japan. Persons over 65 years old will increase from 7% of the total resident population in 1999 to 18% in 2030. Age-related hearing loss is becoming very common and about 50% of those 80 years and above is expected to have significant hearing loss. 

As of FY20/21, SADeaf has a registrar of over 6,000 clients with varies degree of hearing loss and has been supporting them through a series of support initiatives and programmes ranging from hearing care, financial assistance, job employment, legal services, counselling, training and social integration activities. 

With an annual operating expanse projected at S$5million range, we garner this much needed funds through daily appeals and all assistance big and small will come a long way in ensuring our causes continued and those in need are serve with the best available resource. 

Your generous support will make a difference in someone else's life and become you know it, makes someone smile knowing they are able to live their life better and fuller. 

Please make a donation today. 

Visit our website to find out more.

Thank you.

AWWA will be opening a 2nd AWWA School by 2022, located at Bedok, for 300 students age 7 to 18 years old with Autism. AWWA aims to develop the abilities of every child, enabling them to reach their fullest potential. To achieve this, the school adopts an extensive curriculum that includes using assistive technology and communication apps to enhance learning, building facilities that will give our students the opportunity to participate in new activities, and developing a conducive classroom environment for our students.
 
We hope that you can be part of the #BuildASchool campaign to raise $70,000 for 300 students with autism. Your donation will change the lives of many students just like Darius and give them the simple opportunity of going to school.
column47:
Established in 1970, AWWA is a local non-profit organisation that provides community-based programmes and services to people of all ages. From early intervention programmes to special education for children and youth with special needs and multiple disabilities, caregivers support, life-enhancing services for families to senior community home, rehabilitation and outreach programmes and services to enable ageing-in-place and active-ageing, AWWA puts people first. Through our programmes and services, we strive to empower and optimise the potential of our clients to lead dignified and independent lives. 

Visit us at awwa.org.sg to find out more about services and programmes.

column46:
'It's my birthday on the 14th of March and I was thinking of using the day as an opportunity to raise awareness for BABES and help fundraise for your organisation.' 

From 14th March to 14th April, Megha will be aiming to raise $4000 for Babes Discretionary Fund to lend support to teenage girls in need of support. 

Babes Discretionary Fund

Along with dealing with the emotional upheaval of their unplanned pregnancy, many of the teenage girls Babes assist come from needy families who struggle to afford even the most essential food and necessities. The unplanned pregnancy thus puts an immense strain on their tight resources. For girls with no family support, their situation is even more dire. 

The Babes Discretionary Fund aims to tide them with urgent essential expenses as they connect with the relevant agencies for financial assistance.

The fund will be used, and not limited to, to offset:
- Medical consultation 
- Transport
- Mobile top-ups 
- Household items etc
column47: Babes Pregnancy Crisis Support Ltd offers support to pregnant teenagers by proactively providing information and community resources that facilitate responsible decision making. Babes believes that support from her family, friends and wider community is essential for a pregnant teenager to make her decision responsibly and for her to experience a sense of normalcy in this difficult period.

column46:
Sam Fong is glad that he can still see today. He had not heard of glaucoma, and never expected the disease to come to him so suddenly.

Glaucoma, the 'silent thief of sight', accounts for 40% of blindness in Singapore. It damages your vision so slowly that you do not notice the gradual loss until it is too late.

Sam would have lost his sight if not for the early diagnosis and treatment at NHG Eye Institute (NHGEI).

You can help many others keep their vision. Support our Gift of Sight campaign to reduce vision loss due to eye diseases common in Singapore. Your donation will help us to:

- Improve early detection and monitoring of common eye diseases
- Bring eye care into homes and communities
- Improve treatment and patient care
through research and innovation

Join us to reduce vision loss. Fund Vision, Find Sight.
column47:
National Healthcare Group Fund (NHGF), UEN: 201623926M, is a registered charity with Institutions of Public Character (IPC) status.

With the rapid changes in technology and medical environment, NHGF aims to raise awareness on promoting and supporting medical research and education as well as extending related patient care services that will benefit the Singapore community.

The funds raised by NHGF will be used to address and bridge the gaps of existing grants and schemes for research, education and patient care; empower healthcare professionals, scientists and researchers to accelerate research by providing support that is not dependent on external research grants; encourage innovation and pilot research projects to test new ideas; nurture future generations of healthcare professionals through continuing medical education and extending funded healthcare and support to patients who are determined to be in need of assistance to help them with their recovery journey.

column46:
How much do you usually spend on an average day? Do you keep tabs on your online shopping sprees, or calculate your daily expenditure on meals, drinks, cab fares and entertainment?

Why not save up some of your indulgence spendings and give back to the community by donating to an arts and culture or social organisation? A small of $10 gift goes a long way for a non-profit organisation like ours. 

Here are some things you can do if you set aside a small sum each month:
- Donate to support T.H.E Dance Company's dance education programmes
- Donate to other non-profit organisations with causes you believe in
- Attend our classes and learn new skills
- Save up for a rainy day

In an effort to make dance education at T.H.E Dance Company more accessible for those who may face higher barriers to entry due to financial constraints, donations garnered through this campaign will be set aside to support our dance education programmes, which include the enabling of 7 - 8 students and participants to develop and grow their skills and knowledge in contemporary dance. They can then continue their exploration of the art form without being deterred by the cost that goes into sustaining this passion.

Donations raised in 2021 through this campaign will be used in 2022.

Come play a part in making dance education more accessible with The Human Expression (T.H.E) Dance Company.
column47:
Described as a dance company 'at the top of its game', The Human Expression Dance Company (T.H.E), along with our semi-professional training arm, T.H.E Second Company, are names synonymous with ground breaking contemporary dance of the highest quality and artistry. 

Founded in 2008 by Artistic Director Kuik Swee Boon with 6 members, T.H.E has become a household name in Singapore and the region, having commissioned and performed at most major local arts festivals and in prestigious international festivals such as Les Hivernales Festival in Avignon, France; Oriente Occidente Festival in Rovereto, Italy; SIDance Festival and Seoul Performing Arts Festival in South Korea; amongst others.

With our unique brand of highly physical and kinetic works, T.H.E digs deep into the universal human experience. At the heart of our works lies a connection with heritage and collective history as Singaporeans, juxtaposed with incisive, insightful observations on modern society: elements that set apart our repertoire of origina

Our Company is sponsored by Regent Secondary School and Bukit Panjang Gospel Chapel. Thank you for donating!
column47:
The Boys' Brigade (BB) was founded in Glasgow, Scotland, in 1883 as a uniformed youth organisation. Today, the movement has spread across the globe with over half a million members worldwide. 
 
The BB in Singapore was founded on 12 January 1930.  We employ a holistic approach in the development of youths. Through our programme, we hope for our youths to be world-ready, with the passion to act on their dreams and to serve and care for the community.

Boys and Youths discover more about themselves, overcome challenges and broaden their perspectives through our exciting outdoor adventure activities, meaningful community projects and enrichment programmes. Increasingly, the emphasis is on leadership development, team building, life skills, adventure activities and community service.

The BB members' experiential learning journey takes place in three specially designed programmes, namely Juniors Programme (Primary Schools), Seniors Programme (Secondary Schools) and Primers Programme (Polys, JCs and ITEs).

column46:
Together, we can bring Love to Potong Pasir in this post Covid-19 Singapore. For C3, "Potong Pasir" refers to the SMC, which includes potential work in Bidadari and Joo Seng. 

Calvary Community Care (C3)'s work in Potong Pasir centres on empowering people around us - this includes the seniors, youths and children. Donations for Love Potong Pasir will go towards programmes targeted at strengthening social interaction and increasing social mobility of beneficiaries in this estate.

Leveraging on adoption of technology and volunteers, we want to:
1. Help seniors age gracefully in their golden years; and to gain access and understanding to digital technology so they are not left behind in the digital journey;
2. Empower youths through positive engagement, and release them into their fullest potential;
3. Help children grow their love for reading through technology and in-person so as to increase social mobility. We want to enable every child to do well, regardless of their starting point.

Partner us and make a generous donation to Love Potong Pasir. Your donation will have a lasting impact in transforming lives and contribute to a stronger social compact.

Join us in our mission to #LovePotongPasir together. #SGUnited
column47:
Calvary Community Care is a registered charity and member of the National Council of Social Service (NCSS) who works with children, youth and seniors.We have been conferred the Institution of a Public Character (IPC) Status since 2012. Our services centers on helping the sandwich groups - those whose needs are not met because they are less visible.

For more information, visit calvary.sg

In line with AWWA's mission to empower the disadvantaged to lead independent and dignified lives, and our ethos to fill gaps in answer to the needs of the disadvantaged, AWWA will be starting an Adult Disability Home (ADH). With the ADH, 300 clients in the post-18 cohort will have a safe place to live, and their needs provided for. For those whose families are unable to care for them, AWWA ADH provides respite and peace of mind knowing that their family members are well taken care of.

Thank you for your support and contribution to the AWWA Adult Disability Home!
column47:
Established in 1970, AWWA is a local non-profit organisation that provides community-based programmes and services to people of all ages. From early intervention programmes to special education for children and youth with special needs and multiple disabilities, caregivers support, life-enhancing services for families to senior community home, rehabilitation and outreach programmes and services to enable ageing-in-place and active-ageing, AWWA puts people first. Through our programmes and services, we strive to empower and optimise the potential of our clients to lead dignified and independent lives. 

Visit us at awwa.org.sg to find out more about services and programmes.

column46: The Changi Chapel and Museum will reopen with new content and artefacts presented in an intimate and engaging format to tell the story of the prisoners of war (POWs) and civilians interned in Changi prison camp during the Japanese Occupation. As part of the revamp, the National Museum of Singapore has been collecting stories and personal objects from families of former internees that emphasise their personal experiences. The museum's narrative is centred on remembrance and reflection, encouraging visitors to contemplate both the hardships that the internees underwent, as well as their courage and resilience in the face of difficulties.
column47:
The National Heritage Board's mission is to preserve and celebrate the shared heritage of our diverse communities, for the purpose of education, nation building and cultural understanding. It manages the national museums and heritage institutions, sets policies relating to heritage sites, national monuments, and the national collection. Through the national collection, NHB curates heritage programmes and presents exhibitions to connect the past, present, and future generations of Singapore. We need your support in order to grow and sustain our efforts in conserving our heritage and culture. 

For more information on the full scope of NHB's work, https://www.nhb.gov.sg/

Get updates by following us on https://www.facbook.com/NationalHeritageBoardSG/

Pride in our past, Legacy for our Future.

column46:
You can help Transform a Life - the Power is in Your Hands!

Your Giving helps Sponsor the Needs of Disadvantaged Children, Seniors and Families through our programmes and services. Many of whom have fallen through the cracks of society - the disadvantaged child who cannot afford reading and tuition classes, the single mum who struggles to bring food to the table for her family of 6, the frail senior who lives in isolation and at-risk children in need of learning and mentoring support. 

The COVID-19 pandemic has compounded the already challenging situations of our beneficiaries, added financial woes, causing more distress for our vulnerable children, seniors and struggling families. We appeal to your spirit of generosity and compassion to partner and support BCCS to continue to Touch Hearts and Build Lives. Thank you for enabling us to continue to journey with the disadvantaged out of their trying circumstances.
column47:
BCCS provides programmes and services to help the low-income/disadvantaged in the community. We hope to touch their hearts and lives through our personal care and attention. We walk with those in need to give them hope, to get them out of their seemingly helpless predicament, and spur them on in their journey to build their lives with dignity.

Our family-based services and programmes are founded on the belief that every individual deserves a chance to reach his/her potential. BCCS works on the premise that we who are blessed are to share the blessings with those less fortunate in our society through practical help for them. Through our literacy, mentoring, skills training and other family programmes, we reach out to children, youths, seniors and families who are disadvantaged by their circumstances.

column3: Fairy Godparent Programme - Help our children and STOP intergenerational offending!
column37: Thank you for your support! Your donation will help to keep the Fairy Godparent Programme going for our children and families.
column38: Thank you for your support! Your donation will help to keep the Fairy Godparent Programme going for our children and families.

column41: Thank you for your support! Your donation will help to keep the Fairy Godparent Programme going for these children and families.
column46:
The absence of parental figure. Loss of care and trust. Strained family ties. Feelings of shame and abandonment. Social stigma.

"For someone like me, what future is there for me? Nobody cares."

These came from the realities of the children of reformed offenders. When an individual goes to prison, he or she is not the only one affected. Their family members suffer greatly in many ways too, especially the children. Studies have shown that due to the various factors and negative exposures, there is a higher likelihood for them to follow their parent's missteps and commit crimes, a phenomenon known as intergenerational offending.

Through the Fairy Godparent Programme, we reach out to these children from low-income families via various academic and pro-social initiatives (see image 3 for list) throughout their growing up years. When COVID-19 hits, we had to step up and go virtual to continue engaging these children because we know that this is the time the families require support the most, with the pandemic aggravating their already challenging situation. 

With your donation, we can make a difference in these young lives together and provide them with access to opportunities so that they can chart their own paths in life.
column47:
The ISCOS ReGen Fund is a registered charity that supports children and families of reformed offenders as well as the reformed offenders in rebuilding their lives. The charity is an approved Institution of a Public Character (IPC) since 15 March 2019.

Through the Fairy Godparent Programme (FGP), various initiatives are rolled out to empower the children with the opportunity of a complete education and the skills required to be employable and financially independent in future. FGP is designed with the main objective of preventing intergenerational offending.
